Just a quick observation though: were the skids done away with for a reason? It would seem an idea choice for all-terrain landing / space saving.
It was modelled with gears. Nothng I can really do about it. (Im just a texture guy)

Skids doesn't really make sense though, can't be used to land on land and doesn't really help on the water either, especially in KSP, you need wheels to land like a plane, skids would just dig in and you'd flip and die.
The landing gear was done due to lack of support for landingskids, plugin wise. Also, it was a personal aesthetic choice...

I'm pretty sure the LLL "skids" are just landing legs, doesn't actually allow you to skid on them, I haven't tried them though so I can't say for sure.

I assume it would be possible to use a wheel that's invisible attached to a skid that doesn't have a collision mesh or at least doesn't have it on the bit that'd get near the ground to cheat it. Looks like you're skidding on a skid but you're actually rolling on the invisible wheel, give the wheel no drive and some braking and it should behave as you'd expect I think, it's a total hack though.
